revised_title: Fossil Reptilia Structure, Organization, and Classification: A Study on Theriodesmus
tldr: The author examines the structure, organization, and classification of the fossil reptile Theriodesmus, focusing on its limb bones and carpus. They compare the findings to other reptiles, mammals, and amphibians, discussing the similarities and differences in bone structure and form. The author concludes that Theriodesmus shares more similarities with certain reptiles and amphibians than with mammals, challenging the previous classification of the animal as a mammal.
